ol.li: First parameter is the x-field to use, the remaining parameters are just the names you want the output to have.

html.p: Why: Data sometimes comes in already summarized, this is a way to "unsummarize" it. It's sort of the inverse of xyseries.
So What: I honestly have only used it a few times, but it's great when you need it.

The data we are using for this command: | makeresults format="csv" data="location, conditions, observations The Town Hall, Sunny, 14 The Town Hall, Cloudy, 5 The Town Hall, Partly Cloudy, 6 The Park, Sunny, 23 The Park, Cloudy, 2 The Park, Partly Cloudy, 9" | eval _time = strptime(time, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S") | table location, conditions, observations NOTE that the table command is *only* there to enforce column ordering! It has nothing to do with the untable command.
